page.title: 19WEATHER IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content: During this summer of 1985, there has been little sun and much rain. This has affected the ability of the group to undertake a full survey of the whole area. Much of our plot is moorland & uninhabited, thus was not suitable for a school group to study. Unfortunately, the weather also made it unsuitable for us to study in depth as much of the moorland was under water! Attempts to walk over the higher areas were thwarted, & in fact there were reports in the local press about a lady missing on the moors during this period. Also, quite a large area is privately owned, so is not accessible. However, the text & slides describe as much of the whole area as possible, but the point must be made that, for instance, the photographs show the western aspect rather than the typical moorlands.
